summary: The Royalty Transparency Act aims to increase transparency regarding royalties received by executive branch employees and members of certain advisory committees. The bill mandates financial disclosure of royalties, including source and amount, and requires public reporting of royalties received by certain federal employees. It also directs the Federal Acquisition Regulatory Council and the Office of Management and Budget to strengthen conflict of interest reviews for contractors and grantees related to royalty payments, and it requires agencies to report annually on potential conflicts. This legislation seeks to improve oversight and accountability regarding financial interests in the context of government service.
